titleStmt.title: God appearing for the Parliament, in sundry late victories bestowed upon their forces, vvhich command and call for great praise and thanksgiving both from Parliament and people. Die Martis; 4. Martii, 1644. Ordered by the Commons House of Parliament, that Mr. Whitaker, Sir Thomas Widdrington, Mr. Rous, and Mr. Millington, do peruse all the letters that are come from Shrewsbury, Plimouth, Scarborough, Glocestershire, and Weymouth; and make a narrative out of them, of all Gods great and late mercies upon the Parliaments forces, to be printed, and read on the next day of publique thanksgiving. H: Elsynge, Cler. Parl. D. Com.
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Parliament. House of Commons.

notesStmt.note: Quire C in two states: C4v numbered (1) "21" or (2) "22"; line 1 has (1) "The conclusion." or (2) "Die Martis 4. Martii, 1644.".
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
